A while back, the amazingly talented @iamabando reached out to see if it was cool for him to play with an idea he had in his head, based on one of my paintings. Obviously, when Ian says he wants to do something for your project you say YES! The particular painting that inspired him was the one where Raph returns home, battered and bruised, from a late night scuffle. What he came up with is beyond what I could have hoped for. The tone and emotions are bang on, and the storytelling is next level. I’m so grateful he decided to do this, it brings this little project to a whole new level, and somehow makes it feel more real. Ian, THANK YOU! I am eternally grateful for your generosity and talent. I hope you all enjoy this incredible piece he put together, and make sure you turn the sound up! Be sure to let us know what you think! Much love to you all! 🤟💚

Splinter has been successful with his scavenging trips up in the city, and it’s been proven as a viable way for him to provide for his kids. Finding discarded food, clothing and other needs by dumpster diving in secluded areas, but always mindful that he must stay in the shadows and remain undetected. One night, as he was scavenging near an apartment complex, he was attacked by dog. Hurt and unable to escape, all he could think about were his kids. Suddenly he hears a call- “Duke! Get back here!”. A silhouette of a person points a flashlight at the slumped over Splinter. “Are you ok?” he asks, Splinter doesn’t respond. He sits motionless. 
.
Continuing to build my TMNT story, concentrating on Splinter and the boys backstory. I’m also starting to find ways to connect them with the human world. Is this mystery character good or bad? I guess we’ll have to wait till next week to find out 😉. I hope you enjoy this latest piece and addition to the story. As always, looking forward to reading your thoughts! Much love 🤟💚.

A while back, I started a series where I turned Legendary NHL Goalies into Mechs. I was obsessed with being a goalie when I was a kid, everything about them just screamed cool to me. Their helmets were awesome, their equipment were amazing, and the way they moved were incredible. For this particular piece, I chose the legendary New Jersey Devils goaltender Martin Brodeur as my subject. He’s one of my favourite goalies of all time, and his gear setup was always on point, that includes his iconic mask. If you’d like to check out the other goalie mechas I made, you’ll have to scroll through my feed to find them, hopefully it’ll be worth it. If there’s any goalie fans out there, I’d love to hear what you think of this idea, and be sure to let me know who your favourite goalie are; I’m always down for some goalie talk! For you non hockey fans out there, I hope you enjoy this design nonetheless. Have a great Sunday, All! Much love 🤟🤖.

Breaking away from story continuations this week to paint up a moment for Leo. It’s a scene I had in my head for a while, but never got around to it. Leo, alone in Central Park, at one with himself and at peace.  I always imagined he puts a lot of unnecessary pressure on himself, watching over his brothers and making sure they stay on the right track, keeping the family safe- being the big brother. With all this on his shoulders, alone time to reflect and recharge is necessary, and meditation is how he does it. 
.
A bit of backstory behind todays piece. I’ve been struggling with finding the right tone and composition for it the whole week. Last night was particularly hard, trying to put down what’s in my head, and it wasn’t working. It was 2am and it wasn’t happening. I decided to go to bed. Woke up in the morning, and after making breakfast for my family, I decided to give it another go. This painting will not defeat me. Feeling recharged and inspired, I attacked this painting again with a new state of mind. After an hour and a half, I was happy the result. Goes to show sometimes it’s better to get rest and live to paint another day, than to force things. I hope you all enjoy this new piece, it’s definitely become one of my favorites. Looking forward to reading your thoughts and feedback, and thank you as always for the amazing support and positivity! Much love! 🤟💚.

We had one of the first big snowfalls here in Toronto yesterday. We thought it was the perfect opportunity for us to test out a new sled we got for Felix. The sun had already set and the park was empty, we had it all to ourselves. Fresh snow was on the ground, the sled ran great, and we had a magical time. A great way to cap off Marissa’s birthday, and hopefully a moment that Felix will remember forever. 🤟♥️

I love painting these smaller moments, and I hope you enjoy it too. As always, I’d love to know what you think of this piece, and this series in general. Much love 🤟💚.

GRIMLOCK 
.
One of my favourite Transformers of ALL TIME! I’ve been saving him for a while until the time was right to do a re design, and today I felt inspired to do just that. It’s hard to find another Transformer as cool as him, his combination of being a T. rex, power and just being a overall Bada$$, captivated me when I was a kid. I tried my best to keep his iconic look, while updating him to fit the style I already established for my Chen-formers universe. I hope you like his new look! Let me know what you think! 
.
Glad to be back doing some Transformers again. I know it’s been a while, but what better way than to come back to it with Grimlock. Hoping to do more with this series soon!

Paying off a cliffhanger I set up a few weeks ago, where a character approaches Splinter after he’s been attacked. The mystery character that shows up is a new character I created named “Cliff”- the building super. He hears the commotion that was happening outside his apartment complex, and heads out to see what’s up. Upon his arrival, he sees the slumped over silhouette of a figure, motionless. He’s been noticing that the motion detectors outside by the dumpsters have been picking up a lot of activity lately,  he chalked it up to either raccoons or dumpster divers, and he figured this was more of the same. As he approached the figure, it became clear, this was no ordinary person. He freaks out as he sees Splinters true form. As he turns and runs back to the building in fear, he hears a faint “my sons…”, this stops Cliff as he’s even more baffled that this giant rat can talk. He musters up his courage and turns back, Splinter is completely passed out at this point. Cliff knows that he can’t just leave him there, so he brings out a trash bin, loads up splinter, and wheels him back inside. He brings him to his office and attempts to patch up his wounds. Splinter wakes a couple hours later, and finds himself in an unfamiliar place. You can imagine how both Cliff and Splinter are feeling at this time, how incredibly bizarre this situation is, but they attempt to understand more about each other. They have a conversation.
.
Hope you like this new twist to the story. I see Cliff as their first human ally, a confidant that they can trust, and a person that opens up the human world to them. As always, thank you all so much for the continued love and support for this story and my work. Looking forward to reading your thoughts on this new story twist, and Cliff as a character. Much love 🤟💚.

Here’s a super quick Mikey moment to kick off the New Year. Had this image in my head with Mikey doing some early morning training, with the city just waking up around him. I had a bit of time late last night and figured it’ll be fun to sketch this out. I hope you dig it, and here’s wishing everyone a great start to the new year, with much love, health and happiness. 🤟♥️.
.
PS. One of my resolutions for this year is to get more exercise and to live a healthier lifestyle. Sitting around all day in front of the computer, while eating snacks, isn’t the best for anyone. Perhaps this image was inspired by that resolution. Here’s hoping I can be more like Mikey this year-but without the nunchucks 😄.

The FOOT
.
Showing how I see the foot clan for the first time. I think of them as a low level street gang, answering to the Shredder. They’re into all types of crimes, anything that can make the crew money. They are violent and don’t think twice about doing what they have to do to get what they want. They infest the streets and make the community feel unsafe, and that includes the area that the turtles and April lives in. Something needs to be done.
.
This is the first time I’ve introduced the villains in my turtle universe, I really want to concentrate on street level conflicts and stories. We’re not saving the world, we’re saving everyday people and their communities. I hope you like this take on them, looking forward to reading your thoughts! As always, your love and excitement for this project and my work means the world to me, keeps me pushing forward. Much love 🤟💚.

FIRST CONTACT 
.
With Splinter patched up from his injuries, he turns his attention back to his sons. He’s been away for far too long, he’s fearful of what might happen to his boys being left alone. He attempts to get up, but he’s weak, and falls back on the couch. Cliff, seeing this, offers to help. Splinter is weary at first with this offer, but he’s in no condition to get back home by himself. He accepts. Cliff asks where he needs to go, Splinter, in a weak tone whispers “below…”. 
.
Excited to show the moment Cliff meets the turtles. It’s a big step for Splinter to make this decision, but in order to get back to his sons, it’s a risk he’s willing to take. I hope you’re enjoying the continued development of this story, and potentially where it can go from here. I know I’m excited. As always, looking forward to reading your thoughts, and thank you for the continued love and support! Much love 😊🤟.

With Splinter still recovering from his injuries, the family is left without a breadwinner. The turtles are still far too young to venture above the surface by themselves, and the sewers below are filled with many dangers- the survival of the family is in jeopardy. Cliff, recognizing how dire the situation is, steps up. He makes frequent visits down to the sewers to drop off food and supplies for the boys and Splinter. Making sure that he takes the utmost precautions to cover his tracks from the outside world. With each visit, he begins to build trust with the family. He’s being accepted.
.
Bringing you another moment from the turtles story that I’m creating. This moment represents an important bonding moment between Cliff and the boys, trust is being formed, which eventually will lead to him being fully accepted. As always, I want to thank everyone for the love and excitement you’ve continued to show this little project, It’s deeply appreciated. Much love 🤟💚.

TURTLE BABIES!
.

To celebrate that, I decided to sketch this little group shot of the boys to thank everyone for the support. I hope you enjoy these little dudes. Much love, and THANK YOU! 🤟💚

The outside world was always kept hidden from the turtles. Splinter, being the over protective dad, didn’t think they would be able to handle the truths beyond the sewers, so he kept the world away from them. He underplayed it’s wonders, and stressed it’s dangers- it was a place that was off limits to the turtles. With Cliff in the picture now, and the influence he brought from above, the secret was out, Splinter felt it was time to show them the truth. They venture out for the first time, under the cover of the night, and caught a glimpse of their future home. New York City. Their lives have changed forever. 
.
This is a big moment. The boys discovering the world above, there is no turning back now. There’s too much to learn, too much to see and too much to discover.  I hope you like this new addition to my turtle universe, it’s an important moment that will unlock the next stage of my story. I’m so excited to share what’s next to come. I also want to thank every one of you who have been on this journey with me, I appreciate every one of you. Much love 🤟💚.

With the turtles now exposed to the world beyond sewers, their curiosity grows. There’s no stopping them now, they need to learn more. With the blessing of Splinter, they were allowed to venture outside the sewers from time to time; to explore, to play, and to learn. These were wonderful times shared by the brothers, moments that were essential to their bonding, building memories that will galvanize them for life. Each adventure was filled with wonder and excitement, seeing new things, hearing new sounds- experiencing life. 
.
Hope you enjoyed this latest edition to my TMNT story. I wanted to build upon the idea I started last week, with them venturing out into the world for the first time. I wanted another moment to show what these experiences could feel like. As always, I hope you’re enjoying the art and the story. Looking forward to reading your thoughts. Much love 🤟💚.

I was playing with my son last night, when out of nowhere he decided to break out in song. He made up this song about a “Blueberry Spider Monster”, I wasn’t sure where it came from; but it was silly, it was great, and it inspired me. 
.
The idea of a Blueberry Spider Monster stuck with me all night. This morning, I decided to bring it to life. I haven’t used traditional media in a long time, so I broke out the paints and pencils, and went to work. I gotta say, I miss using traditional materials, it was so great to create something that is tactical and real. I had a blast revisiting paints, it was like returning home, or seeing an old friend again. It was wonderful. I decided to document my process in creating these monsters, so swipe along if you want to get a quick glimpse of it. I hope you enjoy it, because I had a blast creating them. As always, looking forward to reading what you think, and I hope these little guys my son and I created brings a bit of joy to your day. I’ll definitely be doing more of these in the future. Much love ♥️.

The sewers were never a safe place. The boys were always taught by Splinter to be wary of their surroundings, stay in the shadows, and to avoid danger- but this time, danger found them. A group of teens exploring the sewers, stumbled upon the turtles as the boys were out on one of their adventures. As to not give away their identities, the turtles tried to act like normal turtles, as Splinter had instructed if they were to ever crossed paths with humans. The teens were taken a back by the size of these turtles,  and began to mess with them. The turtles stayed as docile as possible, but the teens rough housing became increasingly aggressive- the turtles were scared. Raph, not being able to stand the humiliation anymore, broke character and ran away to get help. The teens were astonished as they see Raph sprint away on two feet, they were even more frightened when a mystery silhouette came charging out at them in the distance. They dropped everything and ran for their lives. Splinter saved the boys, but he realized the sewers were no longer safe. It’s time to move.
.
Hope you enjoyed another moment from my turtleverse story. This event really is the motivator for the family to seek a safer place to live, a place where they can call home. I can sense you already know the next step the story will take…😉. As always, please let me know how you feel about this moment, and the story direction in general, looking forward to it! Also, the love and support you continue to show the story and myself means more then you ever know. Thank you! Much love 🤟💚.

Questions.
.
After the experience they went through with the teens, the boys were shook. It’s the first time they experienced a situation like that, a situation that left them feeling helpless. Splinter was able to save them this time, but the experience left them with a lot of questions. Questions about themselves, who they are, where did they came from, and most importantly- why are they different. 
.
Hope you enjoy this latest edition to my TMNT saga. This moment represents a major moment in their lives, for the first time, they’re looking for answers- answers that they may never get. As always, your continued love and support for me and my work is so deeply appreciated, and your kind words continues to drive me forward and give me motivation. Looking forward to reading your thoughts on his latest piece! Much love 🤟💚.

Me Time.
.
Balancing work, family and personal time can be tough. Admittedly, I’ve never been the best at finding that balance. Work will always be a big part of my life, and I put my family time above all else, so naturally, my personal time takes a back seat. 
.
With that being said, I’ve made it a point to create at least one piece of art, that’s purely for myself, every week. It doesn’t have to be an elaborate piece, but it has to be something that gets me excited and brings me enjoyment to create. When do I find time to do this? Well, it’s usually late in the evening during the week, after work is done, family time has been had, and my family is asleep.  Are these always productive hours? Probably not, most of the time it’s just putting in the time until I land on an idea that I can lean into, but most of the time, it’s just me feeling tired and sleepy and calling it a night; coming back the next night to try again. 
.
When you see the pieces I post on Saturdays, it’s usually a culmination of the hours I put in during the week, and a few hours on Saturday mornings to finish up. But what you don’t see are the many failed attempts that never made it. At the end of the day, art is a process, and the process is what I enjoy the most. Not the finished product. Keep on creating, everyone. Even if you’re sleepy 😉🙌.

Bedtime games
.
It’s not easy getting our son to go to bed at night. He’ll find creative ways to avoid going up to his room, anything to delay the inevitable. A trick that’s been working for us lately is to tell him we’re going to go hide from Mommy. We’ll run up to his room, hide under the covers, and wait for Mommy to come find us. Once he’s in his bed, it’s much easier for him to get into sleep mode. Aside from just getting him to sleep, it’s just a special little moment between us. Let’s see how long this will last before we have to change tactics 😊. Here’s wishing everyone a great weekend. Much love 🤟♥️.

My neighbour, Jill, dropped by this morning and asked for a favour. She did some small renovations to her house, and asked if I was free to help her hang a painting. Of course I said yes, and we headed over to her place down the street. When I got there, I noticed the painting was a beautiful print of a Andrew Wyeth piece. She showed me where she wanted it to be hung, and I got to work. That part required a bit of back and forth; hanging, stepping back to check, then adjustments. This process repeated itself for a few rounds, I just couldn’t get it quite perfect enough for her liking. After what seemed like the fifth round, I stepped back and asked “what do you think?”, she paused…then said “you tell me, you’re the artist” followed by “it’s perfect” with a smile. Job well done, and a great way to start off my Sunday. Much love, All. ♥️

MOVING DAY.
.
With the sewers no longer safe, Splinter has made the decision to find a more permanent home for his family.  After much thought, and discussions with Cliff and the boys, it’s time to move above ground- to face NYC. Cliff graciously offered for them to stay in his apartment, at least to start, but the hard part would be to sneak them in and keep them hidden. Under the cover of darkness, Cliff meets the family in a secluded alley. One by one, they pile into the van, taking their meager belongings, bravely facing this journey- the start of a new life.
.
Hope you enjoyed this latest installment of my TMNT saga. This moment represents a huge turning point in their lives, and new story ideas for me to discover. As always, I appreciate all of you for the continued love and support, it means so much to me. Looking forward to reading what you think of this piece and this story moment. Much love 🤟💚.

Every night, as we walk back home from picking up Felix from his grandparents, he asks if we could stop by his favourite mural. It’s a wall filled with wacky monsters painted in the most colourful way- he loves it. We’ll stay there for a bit, taking in the mural, while he makes up stories about the monsters. Once he’s had enough, we’ll head home. Just a little family moment that we love. Let me know if you and your family have a similar traditions, I’d love to hear about it. Have a great Monday, All. 🤟♥️.

NEW LIFE
.
The family makes it safely to Cliffs apartment. After dropping off their belongings, Cliff says he has a surprise for them. He sneaks them up to the rooftop so they can see the sunrise from above the city for the first time. The view from this point of view leaves Splinter and the boys speechless, the scope and scale of the city made them feel so small, but at the same time, gives them a new hope for the future. Welcome to NYC.
.
This is a moment I had in my head for a long time, so I’m happy I finally got to paint this and bring you this new chapter to my tmnt story. I hope you enjoy this new piece, and as always, I’m looking forward to reading your thoughts. Much love 🤟💚.

CJ.
.
Cliff works a demanding job. Always on call, with little time to himself. With the recent discovery of Splinter and the turtles, his life has gotten even more complicated. Through it all, even with all the craziness going on, he finds time for his son. Being a single dad ain’t easy, but he’s trying his best to prioritize the most important thing in his life, his son- Casey. 
.
There you have if folks, the character many of you have been asking for😉. I’ve been building up to this moment for a while now, and it’s been hard not to give too much away before I can reveal Cliff and Casey’s relationship, but I’m happy I can finally introduce him into my story. It’s another story idea that differs from the original, but I hope you guys like it. I’m really looking forward to revealing more in the coming weeks, I hope you guys are excited too. As always, please let me know what you think of this latest story idea, and what you think of the art. Looking forward to reading your thoughts! Much love ♥️🏒🏒🏒.

A few days ago, I discovered there was a Red Tailed Hawk nest across from our house. I’ve been seeing this hawk fly around our neighbourhood for a while now, but never would have though it nested so close to our place. It’s so cool to see this type of wildlife in Toronto, so I was inspired to sketch this out real quick. Trying to distill down the main features of the hawk, while keeping the shapes as simple and graphic as possible. Letting my brush strokes to be loose and not worrying about details or being too tight. This sketch took about 10 mins from start to finish, it’s nice to do these quick sketches from time to time. Hope you dig it, and let me know what you think of this sketching style. Hope everyone is having a great weekend! Much love 🤟.
.
Also, I heard there are even Bald Eagles, and even Golden Eagles, in Toronto, but never seen them before. If any of my Toronto friends have seen them around, please let me know the best places to spot them! I’m on the lookout! 👀

Cliff walks quietly into Casey’s room, and sits by his bedside. Casey’s deep in sleep as Cliff gently nudges him to wake up. “Casey…there’s something I need to show you…”, Casey’s eye’s begrudgingly open a bit, annoyed at his dad for waking him up, what can be so important that it can’t wait till morning? “Don’t freak out…but there’s been something I’ve been keeping from you, something that would be hard to believe, but it’s time I let you know”, Casey slowly gets up from his bed “what is it, Dad?”. “I’ve met some friends…and they’re caught up in a bind, I’ve invited them to stay with us for a bit, but I wanted to make sure you’re cool with it too”. Casey sits up even more “Yeah, sure Dad, whatever they need”, Cliff gives an approving nod, looks towards the bedroom door and says “alright boys, it’s ok to come in”. 
.
Hope you all enjoyed this latest addition to my TMNT story. It’s a big moment, the moment where Casey learns about the turtles, and the secret that his dad has been keeping from him. I can’t even imagine how Casey could have possibly dealt with this situation, and all the questions that he must have, but I’m glad their paths have finally crossed. I’m really looking forward to developing their relationships and story, let’s see what adventures awaits them! As always, please let me know your thoughts on this new story addition, and what you think of the overall story and art so far.  Can’t wait to see what you think! Much love 💚🤟.

Fitting in.
.
“Looks guys, if you’re gonna be hanging around here, we can’t have you lookin like you just hopped outta a fish tank. We gotta disguise you. Here, put these on so you don’t draw as much attention to yourselves.” The boys needed some help putting on their gear, and it took some time, but Casey finally got them looking a bit more inconspicuous. Raph was the only one who didn’t like the new clothes, it felt weird and awkward to him, but he’ll adapt. “Alright boys, looking good! Let’s see if we can sneak you out, there’s a spot of mine I’d like you to check out. Stay close to me, don’t be weird, and act like I do. Let’s go.”
.
Now that Casey and the boys have met, I’ve been excited to play with how they’d interact with each other. I had some time last night and thought I’d quickly get this idea out. It was a lot of fun to paint this, a first step to try and integrate the turtles in with their new surroundings, and the human world in general. I hope you enjoy this one as much as I enjoyed painting it. I had a big smile on my face last night as I was sketching haha. As always, please let me know what you think of this latest moment. I appreciate all the love and support you’ve shown this project and to my art, it truly does mean a lot. Much love, All. 🤟💚

“We’re here. My spot”. Casey pushes open the door to a tiny run down video store. No one’s inside other than the shop keeper, who’s busy watching a movie, ignoring their presence. Casey shuffles the boys inside and disappear into the aisles. They wander the aisles, the boys have no idea what’s going on, but they follow Casey along. After what seemed like hours of browsing, Casey calls out in a whisper “Guys! I found it! This is what I was wanting to show you, my favourite movie of all time, you guys are gonna love it too, I know it”. With a smile on his face, he flips the cover over to show the boys. On the box cover…Enter the Dragon.
.
This is the secret spot Casey’s been so excited to show the boys. I see Casey as a lover of films, and most of all, martial arts films. I hope you enjoyed this new addition to my TMNT story, it’s been exciting getting to explore Casey’s and the Turtles new found bond. So many new ideas to explore, but at the heart of it, it’s the story of their brotherhood that I’m most excited to tell. As always, please let me know what you think of this new story moment. Looking forward to reading your thoughts! Much love 🙌💚.

Casey and the boys leave the video store with their newly rented dvd in hand. He carefully lifts the boys into his shopping cart and begins their journey home. Casey plots out the most inconspicuous way home, trying to avoid people and traffic as much as possible. Dipping and diving out of side streets, alleys and unsavoury areas; always making sure to stay in the shadows. Casey’s street wise enough to know how to handle himself, but now that he has to look out for his new brothers, he’s not taking any chances where he would put them at risk of being discovered. The boys are enjoying this adventure as well, observing and learning along the way. These adventures are something they can get used to, something that they’ll grow to love. The love for New York.
.
I was thinking of a way for Casey to ferry them around the city, and I got this idea that he’d use a old shopping cart to do just that. The image stuck in my head, and I had to play with this idea, so I decided to sketch out this moment late last night. Let me know what you think of this idea of getting the boys around the city. I hope you like it! Much love 💚🙌.

When Casey and the boys returned home, Cliff and Splinter were waiting for them, and they were not pleased. “Casey, how could you be so reckless? Do you know how much danger you could have put yourself and the boys in? You should have known better”. Cliff is clearly disappointed and so was Splinter, not in Casey, but with his own sons. “I thought taking you boys out of the sewers would be for the best, but now I’m having serious doubts. I thought I taught you better, but I guess there’s still a lot more teaching to be done.” The decision is made that there will be no more sneaking out, they will stay within the confines of their home, and only venture out when Cliff and Splinter deem it safe. This is a lesson that Casey and the boys will not soon forget, and trust now must be re-earned. 
.
Hope you enjoyed this latest edition to my TMNT story. With this moment, I wanted to show their are consequences to their actions, and it’s not all fun and games, that this city, and this world, is full of dangers, dangers that they may not truly comprehend until they are older. The fact that they must always stay in the shadows must be reinforced, there is no other choice. As always, looking forward to reading your thoughts on this teaching moment, let me know if Cliff snd Splinter were too hard on the boys. Looking forward to your thoughts, and have a great weekend! Much love. 🤟💚

After the talk they had with Splinter and Cliff, the boys had a lot to think about, especially Casey. That night, Casey couldn’t asleep (the boys had no trouble though), he had a lot on his mind. Although he thought the punishment was harsh, he understood why his dad was so disappointed. Before the boys, his actions only affected him, but now, he has the little ones to think about. His actions sets the tone for how the turtles navigate this world, he can either keep them safe, or lead them into danger. He has siblings to care for now- he’s a big brother.
.
Bringing you another moment from my TMNT story. Casey’s realizing his actions has consequences, and he must make better decisions for the sake of the boys. They look up to him, and what he teaches them now will live with them forever. I originally had another moment planned for today, but decided to switch it up late last night. I wanted to resolve this mini story arc before I moved on. I hope you enjoyed this one! As always, please let me know what you think of this latest story and art addition, always look forward to reading your thoughts! Have a great weekend, All! Much love 💚🤟.

Enter the Dragon
.
It’s been a tense few days between the boys and their dads. To extend an olive branch, Cliff remembered the video the boys brought home, and decided it was time for a movie night. They ordered some food, gathered around the TV, and enjoyed one of Bruce Lee’s finest. The tension faded, and all was forgotten. 
.
Hope you all enjoyed this latest addition to my TMNT story. Figured it was time to do another slice of life moment, I just love painting these. I wanted to show the bond the family had for each other, even though there may be disagreements sometimes- In the end, it’s all love. As always, I appreciate you all for the constant support, encouragement and love for my work, it truly means a lot. Here’s wishing everyone a wonderful weekend! Much love 🤟💚.

After having their minds blown by watching Bruce Lee in action, the boys were pumped! The next day, they were itching to test out their own skills (or lack there of…) with each other. Even though Cliff and Splinter forbade them from heading out into the city on their own, the apartment grounds were allowed. They headed up to the rooftop, where it’s more secluded, and had the time of their lives. Reenacting scenes and moves they remembered from the movie, and crafting their own makeshift weapons out of branches and paper towel rolls. That afternoon, they had the time of their lives, a time that they will never forget.
.
This moment is inspired by my own experiences after I watched the original turtles movie for the first time. My mind was blown and I just had to practice the moves I saw in the film with my cousins and sister. We made or own weapons and re-enacted scenes from the movie. Goes to show the power films have on us, and how they can have a life changing effect on people. I hope you all shared similar moments of inspiration, and related to this moment as much as I did. As always, I hope you enjoyed this latest addition to my TMNT story, and have a great weekend! Much love 🤟💚.

Being in a big city ain’t easy. April is finding it hard to adapt since she moved here for her job at the station. She misses home, her family, and her old way of life. Meeting new people has been hard as well, especially being the introvert that she is. When she’s not at work, she’s by herself at home, the loneliness is starting to get to her. Now with Hoagie being gone most of the time, it’s becoming increasingly difficult for her. She’s heard rumours from her neighbours that they’ve seen him wandering the staircase sometimes, so she decides to wait there one night, in hopes to get to the bottom of where he disappears to all the time…😉
.
I think you know what I’m trying to set up here. That’s all I’ll say this week haha. As always, looking forward to reading what you guys think about this latest moment. I love you all! 🤟😎♥️.

As he turns the corner, he’s met by April, giving them both a suspicious look. Hoagie limps over to April, and she scoops him up into her arms. Raph says nothing and gives April a simple head node, she nodes back. As Raph moves past her, she noticed the red bandana draped behind him- the same red fabric that she found wrapped around Hoagies injured leg. Something is weird, and she’s gonna get to the bottom of this.
.

After the close call in the stairwell, Raph heads back up to his apartment. Splinter is already asleep, and his brothers weren’t back yet, probably working late. He heads out to the fire escape to unwind. He’s been spending more and more time out there lately,  watching over the neighbourhood. The areas been getting worse in recent years, it’s changed a lot, no longer the place he remembered growing up in. More crime and gang activity- people are living scared. There’s not much he can do but to hope things gets better- hope is all they have.
.

Each brother has their own wants and insecurities. For Mikey, being such an extrovert, he craves excitement, new experiences, and interactions with others- the latter being something he can never truly have. He’s always on guard, even when he goes out in disguise, trying his best to enjoy himself, but knowing he must always hide who he is. As soon as others get too close, he’ll push them away and vanish. It kills him to do this, but it’s the only way to keep him and his family safe. A curse that he resents, but understands.
.
Hope you enjoyed this latest addition to my TMNT story. A moment I’ve had in my head for a while, imagining Mikey sneaking out in disguise to hit up clubs and parties, a way to have fun and do what teens do. I imagine him to be an amazing dancer too, which sometimes draws too much attention to himself, but he loves it. As always, I appreciate you all for the constant love and support for this series and my art in general, it truly means a lot reading all your insightful and beautiful comments. Looking forward to seeing what you think of this latest piece! Much love 🤟🧡💚

Mikey’s having a good time at the club, keeping to himself and laying low. He’s vibin to the music when he’s suddenly bumped into, he turns around and sees a dude looming over him. “Hey Bro, you got some of your drink on me. What are you gonna do about it?” the stranger says with a cocky tone. “Looks like you were the one who bumped into me. Maybe you should be more careful next time” Mikey shoots back and turns away. The stranger moves closer and pulls him back “Do you know who I am?”, “I don’t know, and I don’t care” Mikey says and turns to walk away again, not wanting to escalate the situation. As he does, he notices others are moving in, he’s cornered and in trouble. 
.
A continuation of yesterdays post for Mikey. He’s got into a tense situation with these strangers at the club, and he’s gonna have to find a way to get out of it, or maybe confront it head on. I’m starting to ramp up the boys story now, and it’s been fun exploring Mikey’s arc more. Also, I’m sure you can guess who this group of strangers are 😎. As always, I hope you enjoyed this latest piece, and I appreciate all you guys. Here’s wishing everyone a great weekend! Much love 🤟🧡.

Things escalated after the confrontation inside this club, with Mikey getting a beat down he’ll never forget. He was discarded in the alley after all was said and done, and was left with a warning to never show his face around here again. A hard lesson learned, and a violent one.
.
 How many of you guessed that this would be the outcome from last weeks post? They have courage and are fearless, but lack the technical skills at this point, but leaving them room to grow into who they will eventually be. Leo and Donnie became concerned when Mikey didn’t turn up for his shift. He’s known to be flaky at times, but rarely does he not let his brothers know if he wasn’t coming into work. Leo tried calling his cell, but couldn’t reach him- they’re concerned. Donnie remembered Mikey telling him he was going to hit up the club before his shift, so they decided to head down there. After driving around for a bit with no signs of Mikey, their concerns were increasing by the second, that is until they looked into the alley…to see a motionless Mikey laying on the ground. They rush over to help him, they feared the worse but became relieved when they heard him whimper in pain. There was no time for explanations, they quickly picked him up and rushed him over to the van. They strap Mikey in and took off, speeding home, knowing Splinter will know what to do.
.
Continuing with Mikey’s arc I’ve been establishing for the past couple weeks. It’s been fun developing for Mikey, especially since Raph’s arc have been taking shape already. I’m excited to touch on Leo and Donnie’s stories eventually too, I’ve already got some ideas brewing. As always, looking forward to reading what you think of this new moment, and how you think the story and art are taking shape so far! Much love 💚🧡.

Leo and Donnie make it home with Mikey. Both Splinter and Raph were shocked at the state Mikey was in, but there was no time for questions, they layed him down on the couch and began to patch him up. It took them a while, but they managed to fix Mikey up, and left him alone to get some rest. It was an exhausting night for everyone, Leo and Donnie have already passed out, and so has Splinter. Raph couldn’t sleep, partly due to his concern for Mikey, but also from the rage he was feeling inside. A rage that was consuming him, how could someone do this to another? And how did the city get to this point, where violence and crime is running rampant? Is there nothing that can be done about this? Is there no one willing to stop this? There has to be a way.
.

From time to time, Donnie would return back to the sewers. Sometimes just to wander, sometimes even back to the den where they used to live. Even though it’s been years since they left, the underground still calls to him, a place that still feels like home- a place that he can’t quite let go. Perhaps for a sense of nostalgia, but he’s also searching for something, something that he can’t explain, something that is still left unanswered after all these years- where did they come from? And why are they different.
.
Thought it’s about time to dive deeper into their origins, something that I haven’t really touched upon thus far; and who better to lead that part of the story than Donnie. If you remember, many posts before, there was a moment I created where baby Donnie was questioning his origins after they were attacked by the kids, it’s time to pay it off. I hope you enjoyed this latest story moment, and please be sure to let me know what you think of this story arc for Donnie! Much love 🤟💜.

She was recently tasked to write an article on a new narcotic that’s been spreading rapidly in recent months- Edamame. She’s always been a hard worker, but with this new assignment, she’s working harder than ever. Spending late nights at the office, trying to research as much as she can about this new issue. It could be her big break, but is she prepared for the world she’s about to step into? Let’s hope so.
.

With the recent Mikey incident, and seeing the deterioration of his neighborhood, it’s left Raph feeling powerless. He’s taken to going on night walks around his block, to clear his mind perhaps, or maybe he’s looking for something more- something vengeful. .
Hey All, been away for a bit traveling with my family while on vacation, but now I’m back! Just got back from a wonderful vacation with the family down in New Jersey. We had an amazing time, but a personal highlight of mine was making a short trip to Cape May and visiting the Wildwood Aviation Museum. It housed one of my all time favourite fighters, a retired F-14 Tomcat. This was the second time I got to see a Tomcat in person, and it never disappoints. Let me know if there’s any Tomcat fans out there too, I’d love to hear your stories and thoughts about this legendary piece of aviation history! Anytime, Baby! 😎
.
PS. Expect more posts and moments from this vacation. It was wonderful seeing family we haven’t seen in so long, and creating so many new memories with Felix and Marissa 🤟♥️.

Raph takes a moment to assess the situation as the robbery is taking place. “Give up the money!” one of the thugs yells at the distraught cashier, as another dude blocks the exit. With his back turned, Raph senses another approaching him from behind. There’s no use in trying to be peaceful in this situation, it’s clear what’s about to go down. With beads of sweat forming in his skin, Raph makes a choice- act now or end up getting exposed, or dead. He reaches for his bat and unleashes a roundhouse swing right to the body of the approaching thug, laying him out. He then sprints towards the attacker with the firearm, and knocks it out of his hands. He’s in deep now and there’s no turning back. He’s made his choice.
.
You know I couldn’t leave you all hanging after yesterday’s post 😉. Raph has made his choice, and this is the moment that will define his and his family’s destiny. Standing by and doing nothing, just to protect himself, is not in his blood. Let’s just hope he didn’t bite off more than he could chew. As always, I love you all for the continued love and support for what I do, and I hope you enjoyed this latest moment of my TMNT story. Looking  forward to reading what you think of this latest moment, it’s a big one! Much love 💪😤♥️.

The brothers barely escaped that scrap, and if it wasn’t for Leo, it could have been much worse. “I could have handled that” Raph grumbled, “Oh yeah? Didn’t look that way to me. Looked like you were getting your a$$ handed to ya.” Leo shot back. “I didn’t need you to jump in, and what’s with you following me anyway? I’m not a kid anymore, stop treating me like one” Raph said, holding back his anger. Leo, sensed things are getting heated, whispers with a soft, calming tone…”you’ll always be my lil bro”. With that, nothing else needed to be said, it’s understood. Raph and Leo sit in silence as they watch the sun rise, with the sounds of the city waking around them. It’s a new day. 
.
Hope you enjoyed this bit of closure to the chaos that’s been happening over the past few episodes. I thought it was important for the brothers to have this moment, a moment for them to acknowledge what happened, but more importantly, for them to be there for each other. It was nice to finally wrap up this mini story beat, looking forward to pushing the story even more and see where it takes me. As always, please let me know how you feel the story and art is progressing, always excited to read your thoughts and feedback. Much love 🤟♥️.

April gets a early morning text from her editor about a robbery that took place last night, and told to get on the scene asap to cover the story. April shows up just as the police finishes their investigation, but nothing seems out of the ordinary at first glance, seems like your run of the mill stick up, the suspects seemed to have been apprehended as well. April interviews a few passersby’s and snaps a few photos as she wraps up her coverage. She’s feeling a bit annoyed that her boss would wake her up for something so trivial, when she notices a little boy sitting by himself. She approaches him and introduces herself “Hey, I’m April, what’s your name?”, “I’m Jose…” the little boy replies in a soft tone. “What are you doing hanging around here, it’s not the safest place to be right now, you should head home” April says with a smile, “I am home” the boy replies, turns out he’s the Bodegas owner son, and he saw the whole thing go down last night, he was hiding behind the counter doing homework-he saw it all. April, seeing an opportunity to build on the story, tries to get more info from Jose. “There was a man in black, he saved us. He fought away the bad guys” Jose says, April presses for more info “oh yeah? What did this man look like? He sounds like a hero to me”. Jose looks around and hesitantly pulls out a piece of paper and hands it to April “Here, I drew a picture”.
.
Hope you enjoyed this latest story moment to my TMNT story. Really starting to ramp up the story now and trying to connect the dots. I see this moment as one of the bigger moments in the story thus far, and will really help to drive the narrative moving forward. As always, I appreciate each and every one of you for the incredible amount of love and support you’ve shown for me and my work, it’s truly appreciated; and I can’t wait to hear what you think of this moment and the overall story direction so far. Much love 🤟😎.

A group of young men enters a restaurant and walks over to a table. “Boss..Hung, Ray and Minh got caught up last night doing some stupid $hit. They’re locked up at the Tombs right now” one of the men tells the man dining at the table. “Get the lawyers on it, they’ll have them out in no time” as Riku takes another bite of noodle, “Already on it, but there’s more…apparently they got roughed up pretty bad last night” the young man continues, “Not sure what happened, but seems like one dude messed up all three of them. The Boys have renewed their sense of brotherhood through the recent events. .

April walks into the apartment complex after another long day at the office. She’s been going hard on the Edamame story for a while, and now with this mystery hero popping up, it’s given her extra motivation to find connections- this could be her big break. As she walks towards the elevators, she sees one just about to close, she runs towards it, hoping to catch it before it leaves. Just as she thought she missed it, the doors open up. April steps inside “Oh, Thank you so much, not sure how long I’d have to wait until the next one arrives. You’re a life saver”. The man smiles back as April continues “you know, these elevators have been terrible, can’t believe no one’s fixed the other two broken ones yet. It’s been like this for weeks, it’s getting ridiculous”. The man smiles back “it’s been tough ordering parts, especially with the building cut backs. I’ll get on it soon though. Sorry for the inconvenience” he says with a warm smirk. April notices his superintendent uniform for the first time, partially blocked by a big stack of pizza boxes. “Oh, I’m so sorry, I didn’t mean to be rude. It’s been a long day…” Cliff cuts her off “No, apologies needed, been a long day for me too”. April smiles back in embarrassment, “I’m April btw, I live on the 9th floor, nice to meet you”, the old man says with a smile “Nice to meet you too. I’m Cliff”.
.
I know he’s been missing for a bit, but I’m happy that Cliff is back. As you can see I’m really starting to connect the dots, it’s been fun setting up these characters, but it’s time to bring them together. I hope you’re enjoying how the story is unfolding, and the world I’m attempting to build. As always, I appreciate you all for the constant support and love for what I’m trying to do, it truly means a lot. Looking forward to reading what you think of this latest moment. Much love! 🤟♥️.
.

It was a welcomed visit from Cliff, especially with the pies he brought with him. The boys didn’t waste any time and dug right in. As everyone was  busy stuffing their faces, Splinter gently taps Leo’s shell, and gestures for him to follow. They step out into the night air, and sit down. “I know what you did for Raph” Splinter begins, “did what…?” Stutters Leo. “You’re my son, I know everything. You don’t think I see you sneaking out after Raph every night? I read about what went down at the bodega. Where the mystery hero’s with the green masks saved the shop owner ?”, Leo looks down, preparing himself for the scolding. “I’m proud of you” Splinter says, Leo looks up in shock “what?”. “You looked out for your brother, it’s what I always wanted from you boys. You only have each other in this world, if you don’t protect each other, who will?”, Leo sits up a bit straighter knowing he’s not in trouble. “However, you both could have gotten seriously hurt, you got lucky this time. I don’t want this to continue, you hear me?”, Leo nods in acknowledgement. Splinter nods back “alright, now go back in before your brother eats all the pizza”, Leo smiles and gets up when splinter stops him. “Not so fast. I almost forgot your punishment. Give me your phone. You’ll get it back in two weeks.” Leo sighs, and hands over his phone reluctantly. “You should see what I have in store for Raph” Splinter says with a smirk as they both climb back in to rejoin the family.
.
Hope you enjoyed this latest chapter to my TMNT story. This moment was an attempt to solidify Leo’s role as the leader of the brothers, to have Splinters belief in him must mean a lot to Leo, and hopefully instill the confidence he needs moving forward as the protector of the family. As always, I hoped you enjoyed this moment. Looking forward to reading what you think! Much love! 💙

The word on the street is that there’s a bounty out for the ones who beat down the dudes in the bodega. Splinter, fearing for Raph and Leo’s safety, imposed a lock down, forbidding the boys to leave the apartment complex until things die down. It wasn’t a welcomed decision from the boy’s perspective, but they understood and obeyed. It gets pretty boring being cooped up in the apartment, so Splinter volunteered their services to help Cliff do some maintenance work around the complex- if they’re going to be hanging around all day, might as well make themselves useful. .

Cliff has been putting the boys to work since Splinter ordered the lock down. They’ve been doing repair work and maintenance around the complex where they could, but the boys are starting to feel restless. Splinter and Cliff notices, and decides to find a way for them to release their energy. They lead them down to the boiler room, unlocked the door, and lead them in. It was dark and dusty, filled with random storage boxes, like it hadn’t been cleaned in years. “This… is the surprise you guys were telling us about?” Mikey said in a stunned tone, as the brothers looked at each other with unimpressed smirks. “I know this doesn’t look like much, but it was a special place for me” Cliff said, “I know you might not believe it, but I used to kick box in my younger days, long before we even met. I stopped after I got injured, but the hunger to train never left me, so I built this place” he looks around the room nostalgically. “Used to train here all the time, and even helped Splinter rehab here when he got hurt. It’s been a long time since it’s been used, but with some tidying up, you boys are free to use it, I can even give you a few pointers if you like. Might come in handy one day” as he gives Raph a glance and a smile- Raph looks down with embarrassment. The boys looked around at the old equipment and figured there’s worse ways they could spend their time, and with the recent heat they’re catching they could use the training. They took Cliff up on his offer and began to clean.
.
Hope you enjoyed this latest story moment to my TMNT story, and I think you can see where I’m headed with this 😉. As always, I appreciate each and every one of you for the love you’ve shown to me and this project, and I look forward to reading what you think of this latest story turn. Much love 💪😎🔥.

The boys have been putting in work getting the training room back in shape. This morning, as they stepped into the boiler room, they were shocked. They see a version of Splinter that they never seen before- he was training. Hitting the heavy bag with a ferocity that the boys never could imagine, and performing kicks with such grace and precision that it left the boys speechless. Splinter stopped his training as he sensed the boys step into the room, “not bad for an old guy, huh?” he said with a smile, but quickly needing to sit back down. The boys rush over to him, “What was that??!!” Leo said with amazement, “Where did you learn how to do that??!”. Splinter, still catching his breath, chuckled “just things I picked up when I was younger, you boys were too young to understand, but the world is a scary place, every time I ventured above ground to provide, could have been my last” Splinter said, still exhausted. “I learned to be quick and agile, by necessity, I learned to protect myself at all cost because I had to make it back to you boys. But after my accident, and we moved above ground, I trained less and less, until I stopped completely”. Splinter attempts to stand up, but can’t, and slumps back down “these old bones just aren’t the same anymore, time will do that to ya…” he says with a chuckle. “After Cliff opened the gym back up, I guess it got me thinking again, thinking I still had it in me…I guess it was silly of me” he continues with a dejected tone. The boys gather closer to comfort Splinter, “but even if I can’t do it anymore, there are things I can still pass onto you. I never wanted you boys to need these skills, but there’s a threat looming, I can feel it”. Splinter finally stands up, with the assistance of his cane “if you boys have the patience to learn…I’ll do what I can to teach”, the boys look at each other and nod in unison.
.

It’s been almost a year since April moved to New York, and she’s still having a hard time adjusting to the city. Work has been hectic and takes up most of her time, and being an introvert, makes it hard to meet people. She’s tried to step out of her shell by going out with her small group of coworkers, but quickly realized she doesn’t fit in; They’re super extroverted while she prefers smaller groups in quieter settings. She can’t help but feel like she’s different, an outsider hoping to one day find her tribe. A tribe to belong to.
.

The boys have been training hard with Splinter and Cliff for a few weeks. Not sure if they’re enjoying it, but they’re improving day by day. Raph has been pushing especially hard, sometimes a bit too hard. He never wants to have what happened to him in that bodega to happen ever again, and the only way to do that is to train. It’s become an obsession, and he holds his brothers accountable too, they all must be strong. Strong for each other.
.
Every good movie needs a training moment right? Well, here’s one for ya. I also wanted to show how serious the boys are taking the tutelage from Splinter and Cliff, they understand how important it is for them to be able to handle dicey situations they might run into, especially with the heat they caught recently. As always, I hope you dig this latest moment, and I look forward to reading what you think! Much love 💪🐢🐢🐢🐢.

It’s been almost a month since Splinter imposed the lockdown. Although the heat has been dying down, he’s still uncomfortable with letting the boys out, at least not right now. The boys have been training to kill time, putting in the work, and seeing results; but the isolation has taken its toll on them. Mikey, suggested they sneak out, just for a bit, to let loose. Although they all know this will be going against Splinters wishes, they kinda agree it’s what they needed. Leo is the most antsy about this idea, but was convinced by his brothers nothing will happen, they’ll return before anyone notices, Splinter and Cliff will never know. Reluctantly Leo agrees, and under the guise of going downstairs to train, they sneak out instead. The boys step out for the first time in a long while, breathing the fresh air, and disappear into the city. Nothing bad can happen…right? 
.
I’m back! It’s been a busy time for me so I haven’t had time to create any new pieces the past couple weeks, but I’m happy I can bring you a new addition today. What do you think? Good idea or bad idea for the boys to break the rule and head out? I’ll let you decide. As always, I hope you enjoy this latest piece, and I’ll be looking forward to reading your thoughts! Much love 🤟❤️🧡💙💜.

It felt good being back out and experiencing freedom again, even if they did disobey Splinter and Cliff to do so. They know what they did was wrong, but there’s something about breaking the rules that made this outing a bit more exciting. Also, even though the heat is still on them in the streets, the training they’ve been receiving gave them an air of confidence, knowing they’re better equipped to handle whatever comes their way. Day quickly turns to night, they know they better head home before their covers blown, but before they do…there’s one more thing they gotta deal with…dinner.
.
Hope you all enjoyed this latest moment. Wanted to do something this week to show them just vibin with each other, enjoying their outing, and enjoying some brotherly bonding; and what better way to show that than with pizza 😊. As always, I appreciate each and every one of you for the constant love and support, and I’m looking forward to reading what you think of this one. Much love 🤟😊.

The boys head home, still riding high from the fun they had that evening. The mood was light, they crack jokes and laugh about how much trouble they’d be in if Splinter found out about what they’ve been up to. They continue to clown around as they jaywalk across the street recklessly, stopping traffic in the process. A car screeches to a halt as Raph motions an apology to the driver and hurries across the street with his brothers. The passengers of the car, in that split second, recognizes that flash of red across Raph’s face. It’s who they’ve been looking for.
.
Happy to bring you another installment of my TMNT story. Looks like the boys recklessness have finally caught up with them, they let their guard down and they’re about to reap the consequences. Let’s see how they’re gonna get out of this one. As always, hope you enjoyed this story moment, and I’m excited to read what you think of it! Can’t wait to show you what’s next! 🔥🔥🔥

Shots rang out, the boys are taking fire.  Bystanders scatter in panic as a black Mercedes chases the turtles through the streets. The boys are running for their lives as they desperately try to find ways to escape. It’s total chaos, and the armed men fire recklessly into the crowd, they have one goal, and they don’t care how they achieve it. The turtles, in an attempt to prevent people from getting hurt, draw the attackers down an alley, away from the crowd. They don’t have a plan, but they need to protect those who are innocent- whatever it takes.
.
Well, looks like the turtles bit off more than they could chew this time. The danger they are facing this time is unlike anything they’ve experienced before. Will they get out of this situation alive? We’ll have to wait and see. As for the art itself, this piece was particularly fun to paint, I kept things loose to preserve the energy of the moment, and if you look at the closeups, you’ll see how loose I like to paint. Hope you enjoyed this latest story development and the art, looking forward to reading what you think! Much love 💥💥💥.

The Turtles frantically race down the alley, with the black Mercedes in pursuit. Their lungs burning, legs tired, shots booming behind them, they continue to push forward- they have no choice. They see a glimmer of hope ahead as they near the end of the alley, but that hope is quickly dashed when silhouettes of men emerge from the shadows to block them- they’re trapped. The boys stop and draw close to each other, still breathing hard, and realizing the dire situation they’re in. The Mercedes pulls up and stops behind them, the two men they beat down in the bodega step out with bad intentions. The turtles are not sure how they’re going to get out of this one, but they know they have each other, and they’ll get out of this together…somehow.
.
Hope you enjoyed another episode of my TMNT story. Things are ramping up for sure, and I’m excited to see how the boys will get out of this jam. Will they run? Or will they fight? I guess we’ll have to wait a bit till we find out 😉. As always, looking forward to reading what you think of this story moment and the artwork. I appreciate you all!! Much love 💪🐢🐢🐢🐢.

Riku strolls nonchalantly into a dimly lit room, with his Kendo gear in tow. His father, Oroku, is already geared up and in deep meditation. It’s a ritual they’ve had together since Riku was young, a practice that Oroku had hoped would bring some humility and patience to his son. Riku approaches and greets his father, but before he even utters a word, Oroku cuts him off “What you do outside this building is none of my business, but you’re flying too close to the sun”. “Father?” Riku replies, “The stuff you’re selling, it’s attracting too much attention, and you’re being too reckless. You’re expanding too quickly and your crew is running around like a pack of feral dogs, it’s going to get out of hand” Oroku continues, “I want you to pull back, I don’t want any of your business to taint what I’ve built here. I’ve worked too hard for it to all crumble because of you. Do we understand?”. Riku, reluctantly, can only nod, while holding back his anger inside. Oruko nods back in response, and accepts a duffle bag of cash Riku hands over to him. Oroku’s share for supplying the Edamame.
.
What do you guys think about this latest development? I wanted to reveal more about who Shredder is and his motivations, but most importantly, the relationship dynamics between him and his son. I hope you’ve enjoyed it, and I can’t wait to read what you all think. Much love 😎⚔️💜🖤.

The boys find themselves trapped, and there’s only one way to get out, and that’s to fight- and fight they did. Their training and hard work paid off, they fought as a team, they fought together, they fought as brothers. The Foot was no match for the turtles, even though the boys skills were still rough and unpolished, it was enough…For now. 
.
Been waiting to paint this moment for a while now, the moment the brothers come together and display their skills. Definitely a fun one to paint. I’m sure the Foot and Riku won’t let this one down easily, and there will be retaliation for sure, let’s hope the boys are ready for what’s to come. Oh, let me know if you noticed an important Easter egg/clue that I left in the painting that may give you some insight into the next episode 😉. As always, I hoped you enjoyed the art and this latest episode, looking forward to reading what you think! Much love 💜♥️🧡💙.
